util.logging

Class StandardConsoleHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.Handler
      • java.util.logging.StreamHandler
        • java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler
          • util.logging.StandardConsoleHandler

  • public class StandardConsoleHandler
extends ConsoleHandler
    The StandardConsoleHandler is a ConsoleHandler which logs to System.out. The logs get formatted using the StandardFormatter and the default object has no Filter set.
    Author:
    Loris

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StandardConsoleHandler()
      Creates a new StandardConsoleHandler with default settings.
      StandardConsoleHandler(Level level)
      Creates a StandardConsoleHandler with specified log level and otherwise default configuration.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler

        flush, isLoggable, setEncoding, setOutputStream

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • StandardConsoleHandler

        public StandardConsoleHandler()
        Creates a new StandardConsoleHandler with default settings. Forwarded logs are formatted using the StandardFormatter, the log level Level.INFO is set and no Filter is installed.
        See Also:
        Handler

      • StandardConsoleHandler

        public StandardConsoleHandler(Level level)
        Creates a StandardConsoleHandler with specified log level and otherwise default configuration.
        Parameters:
        level - The new value for the log level
